comments.body:
Quick note about the helper script:

this section appears to concern actually copying and relocating already built binaries from the tarball.

is this something that we should be doing?
Yes, its for binary repacking, but afaik currently not used here...
Thanks. Do you know if it is used for any R package on conda-forge?

It came via the two commits:
* https://github.com/conda/conda-build/commit/0c1842ccf232e32bf6905949fab51c5fc50fbe82#diff-3709110e1881a8612ef68dffa45ea033L124
* https://github.com/conda/conda-build/commit/0412ba8866229341e14155c7b6a79c9c22a13613#diff-3709110e1881a8612ef68dffa45ea033R151

I don't know of any conda-forge package where this is used. At least `rg use-binaries feedstocks/` tells that the parameter `use-binaries` is not used in any of 5k the conda forge feedstocks.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +8,12 @@  if [[ $target_platform == osx-64 ]]; then
    pushd $PREFIX
      for libdir in lib/R/lib lib/R/modules lib/R/library lib/R/bin/exec sysroot/usr/lib; do
        pushd $libdir || exit 1
          for SHARED_LIB in $(find . -type f -iname "*.dylib" -or -iname "*.so" -or -iname "R"); do
